meanings.definition: The action of making something obscure, unclear, or difficult to understand.
meanings.sent1: The obfuscation of the instructions made it hard to assemble the toy.
meanings.sent2: The politician's obfuscation of the issue left the audience confused.
meanings.sent3: The magician's obfuscation of the card trick left the audience scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The obfuscation of truth in the gossip spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The obfuscation of the treasure map added an exciting challenge for the adventurers.

meanings.definition: The act of deliberately making something more confusing or complex.
meanings.sent1: The obfuscation of the legal jargon made it hard for the average person to understand.
meanings.sent2: The obfuscation of the data was meant to hide the company's true financial situation.
meanings.sent3: The obfuscation of the recipe made it seem like a secret code to decipher.
meanings.sent4: The obfuscation of the path through the maze added an extra layer of challenge.
meanings.sent5: The obfuscation of the truth only served to deepen the mystery surrounding the case.
